column3: Just as a general hint for the approach of "get a few green runs", it's also possible to register at travis-ci.org with your github account and add your forked bitcoin repository there: then on every push the CI will be triggered as well. This proved to be very helpful for me personally, as check before I opened PRs, as I wrongly assumed for some reason that the CI runs can only be triggered here

thanks for the tip @theStack ! \n\nso you were able to get travis passing on your forked repo? when I tried previously I wouldn't get meaningful results, eg. they would frequently time out or error for unrelated reasons. But I didn't investigate too closely, so I can take another look

> so you were able to get travis passing on your forked repo? when I tried previously I wouldn't get meaningful results, eg. they would frequently time out or error for unrelated reasons. But I didn't investigate too closely, so I can take another look\n\nIt could be that on a first build you have to restart the job manually from the Travis dashboard, if a message like this appears at the very b
I tried on three machines and could not reproduce the issue locally
From @jonasschnelli on IRC: Fails also on https://bitcoinbuilds.org/?job=cda0e018-8437-4dea-80b8-283fd445ec8a
@jonasschnelli Can the build be reproduced locally? Is it using depends or system boost?

I looked a bit into it.
This PR seems still to fail on bitcoinbuilds.org:
https://bitcoinbuilds.org/index.php?job=2f3c8572-cbaf-4cab-a2d2-20809d713084

What I observed was that only the depends-build configuration fail (system-libs configuration works). If I clear the ccache-cache, the build runs successful.

Maybe that helps identifying the issue.
> If I clear the ccache-cache, the build runs successful.\n\nI think the failure is intermittent, so it might be hard to draw conclusions early.

> I think the failure is intermittent, so it might be hard to draw conclusions early.\n\nIt seems to fail on bitcoinbuilds.org 100% on "Linux x86_64 depends" "Linux 32 depends" when using ccache/dependency cache.

I am finally able to reproduce on a single CPU instance on gce `n1-standard-1 (1 vCPU, 3.75 GB memory)`

I am using depends with `NO_QT=1 NO_WALLET=1` and ccache. The bug is only reproducible once after each reboot with: `cd bitcoin/ && while sudo bash -c 'rm -f ./src/test/test_bitcoin && (echo 1 > /proc/sys/vm/drop_caches) && make -j 2 check'  ; do true ; done`

I could not reproduce it w
@jonasschnelli @MarcoFalke I'm unable to reproduce :(\n\nWhat toolchain are you compiling using? Is there any theory as to why the use of `ccache` would matter?
Also, are you able to trigger it when doing `src/test/test_bitcoin -t scheduler_tests`?
thank you all for your help with this bug ! \n\nI opened issue #18227 to track findings & continue investigation
